title: Strictly's Craig Revel Horwood trolls Bruno Tonioli over shirtless selfies
text:
Craig thinks Bruno should cover up (Picture: Wenn/Instagram)

Craig Revel Horwood has begged his fellow Strictly Come Dancing judge to stop posting shirtless selfies.

Known for his low-cut shirts on Strictly, 63-year-old Bruno can be found on Instagram posing with friends in various states of undress.

What can we say; he loves his Speedos.

However, it seems like Craig is less than impressed by his co-star’s pics, turning his famous Mr Nasty critiques away from our Strictly stars as he laid into Bruno.

‘He had a good body when he was in Elton John’s I’m Still Standing video but that was 30 years ago, darling,’ Craig told the Daily Star, ‘He should learn to start covering up.’

Meow!

Never one to stop pulling punches, Craig continued: ‘There should be a limit to what he is showing people, I think.

‘Bruno is in love with himself and his body. He thinks he has got the body of a 23-year-old.’

The judge came under criticism this week for siding with head judge Shirley Ballas and controversially voting to send home Catherine Tyldesley over Mike Bushell.

But despite Shirley receiving death threats over her decisions on the show, Craig believes that, while social media has made all fans into critics, ‘everyone is entitled to their own opinion.’

He added: ‘When we first started 16 years ago, there was no social media. Everyone now has an iPhone and they are tweeting and everyone has an account.’

Speaking about the decision to send Catherine and Johannes home over favourites to leave Mike and Katya, Craig said: ‘For us the judges, we have to judge the dance off only, not what happened previously or what is to become and you can only judge what you see in that one minute thirty and in my opinion Mike had the cleaner dance.

‘It’s quite simple and you know if it was another day or if Catherine was doing a rumba for instance, against his tango, then she would have won it. But you know it’s what happens on the day.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 7pm with the results show on Sunday at 7.15pm on BBC One.
